summary: The diff implements most of the required features for the Param Shopping marketing app, including a landing page, warm visual theme, and backend marketing content endpoint. However, the backend stores incorrect app content (wrong app name 'Noxium AI' and unrelated features/tagline instead of Param Shopping content), which is a critical issue for REQ-3. All other requirements appear substantially implemented.

missing_requirements.requirement: Backend must store and expose marketing content for Param Shopping including correct app name, tagline, feature list, and CTA text
missing_requirements.reason: The backend in backend/main.mo stores content for a completely different app: appName is 'Noxium AI', tagline is 'AI-powered productivity suite for businesses', and features are 'Automated document processing', 'Smart scheduling', 'Data analysis tools' â€” none of which relate to Param Shopping. The frontend fallback in useQueries.ts does use 'Param Shopping' but the backend data is wrong.

hallucinated_features.description: WhyUsSection component with stats row and benefits checklist
hallucinated_features.reason: The build request only asked for a hero section, features/benefits section, CTA section, and footer. The WhyUsSection is an additional unrequested section.

hallucinated_features.description: App Store and Google Play download badges in the CTA section
hallucinated_features.reason: The build request did not specify app store badges; it only asked for a generic CTA such as 'Download Now' or 'Get Started'.

hallucinated_features.description: Internet Identity authentication provider and login infrastructure
hallucinated_features.reason: The build request explicitly lists user authentication and account management as a non-goal, yet useInternetIdentity.ts and the InternetIdentityProvider are included and wrapped around the entire app.
